title: "associated function without body" error suggestion has incorrect span

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
It suggests

```
fn foo({ <body> }
```

when it should suggest

```
fn foo() { <body> }
```

or at least suggest

```
fn foo(){ <body> }
```

-----

```rust
struct Foo;

impl Foo {
    fn foo()
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=66722d21ea825943bd00d51975489cb6))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: expected one of `->`, `;`, `where`, or `{`, found `}`
 --> src/lib.rs:5:1
  |
4 |     fn foo()
  |        ---  - expected one of `->`, `;`, `where`, or `{`
  |        |
  |        while parsing this `fn`
5 | }
  | ^ unexpected token

error: associated function in `impl` without body
 --> src/lib.rs:4:5
  |
4 |     fn foo()
  |     ^^^^^^^-
  |            |
  |            help: provide a definition for the function: `{ <body> }`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```
